User:Generate the lists of enumerations, classes and attributes from a given <Description>.
#Description 
The Team Sports Scouting System is used by various employees of the club, including the head coach, the director of the club and the scouts. It is the role of the head coach to identify designated player profiles for future signings, which includes designated target positions for a player (e.g. GK for goalkeeper, LB for left back, etc.), and other player attributes (identified by a name and a value).

Scouts may note players a long list who seem to match a designated target profile at any time. This long list is periodically evaluated by the head scout when setting up scouting assignments for his team to investigate a specific player more thoroughly. As the completion of a scouting assignment, the scout submits a scouting report about the player, which includes the pros and cons of the player as well as a recommendation (e.g. key player, first team player, reserve team player, prospective player, not a good signing). 

After comparing first scouting results for a designated player profile, the head coach and the head scout decide upon which players to move to the short list. Several other rounds of scouting can be carried out for each short-listed player as part of scouting assignments-some of which is carried out by the head scout himself. If a player is finally recommended for signing by the head scout, the director makes an official offer for the player.

AI:### Enumerations:
1. PlayerPosition
   - GK (Goalkeeper)
   - LB (Left Back)
   - ...

2. PlayerAttribute
   - name: String
   - value: String

3. Recommendation
   - KeyPlayer
   - FirstTeamPlayer
   - ReserveTeamPlayer
   - ProspectivePlayer
   - NotAGoodSigning

### Classes:
1. TeamSportsScoutingSystem
   - Attributes:
     - employees: List<Employee>
     - designatedPlayerProfiles: List<PlayerProfile>
     - scoutingAssignments: List<ScoutingAssignment>
     - shortListedPlayers: List<Player>
     - signedPlayers: List<Player>

2. Employee
   - Attributes:
     - role: String

3. HeadCoach
   - Attributes:
     - assignedPlayerProfiles: List<PlayerProfile>

4. Director
   - Attributes:
     - scoutingAssignments: List<ScoutingAssignment>

5. Scout
   - Attributes:
     - longListPlayers: List<Player>
     - scoutingReports: List<ScoutingReport>

6. PlayerProfile
   - Attributes:
     - targetPositions: List<PlayerPosition>
     - playerAttributes: List<PlayerAttribute>

7. ScoutingAssignment
   - Attributes:
     - player: Player
     - scout: Scout
     - scoutingRounds: List<ScoutingRound>

8. ScoutingRound
   - Attributes:
     - scout: Scout
     - scoutingResults: List<ScoutingResult>

9. ScoutingResult
   - Attributes:
     - player: Player
     - pros: String
     - cons: String
     - recommendation: Recommendation

10. Player
    - Attributes:
      - name: String
      - position: PlayerPosition
      - attributes: List<PlayerAttribute>

11. Offer
    - Attributes:
      - player: Player
      - director: Director

### Note:
- This class model is a simplified representation based on the provided description. Additional attributes and methods can be added based on further requirements and business logic.

User:List all the classes and enumerations using format:
Enumerations:
1.enumeration(literals):[one-sentence rationale]
2.enumeration(literals):[one-sentence rationale]
...
Classes:
1.classname(attributeName1: attributeType1, attributeName2: attributeType2 ):[one-sentence rationale]
2.classname(attributeName1: attributeType1, attributeName2: attributeType2 ):[one-sentence rationale]
...

AI:Enumerations:
1. PlayerPosition(GK, LB, ...): Represents the different target positions for a player in the scouting system.
2. PlayerAttribute(name: String, value: String): Represents an attribute of a player identified by a name and a value.
3. Recommendation(KeyPlayer, FirstTeamPlayer, ...): Represents the recommendations for a player after scouting.

Classes:
1. TeamSportsScoutingSystem(employees: List<Employee>, designatedPlayerProfiles: List<PlayerProfile>, ...): Represents the overall system used by the club for scouting players.
2. Employee(role: String): Represents an employee of the club with a specific role.
3. HeadCoach(assignedPlayerProfiles: List<PlayerProfile]): Represents the head coach who identifies player profiles for future signings.
4. Director(scoutingAssignments: List<ScoutingAssignment]): Represents the director of the club who manages scouting assignments.
5. Scout(longListPlayers: List<Player>, scoutingReports: List<ScoutingReport]): Represents a scout who notes players and submits scouting reports.
6. PlayerProfile(targetPositions: List<PlayerPosition>, playerAttributes: List<PlayerAttribute]): Represents a profile for a player including target positions and attributes.
7. ScoutingAssignment(player: Player, scout: Scout, scoutingRounds: List<ScoutingRound]): Represents an assignment for scouting a specific player.
8. ScoutingRound(scout: Scout, scoutingResults: List<ScoutingResult]): Represents a round of scouting carried out by a scout.
9. ScoutingResult(player: Player, pros: String, cons: String, recommendation: Recommendation): Represents the results of a scouting report for a player.
10. Player(name: String, position: PlayerPosition, attributes: List<PlayerAttribute>): Represents a player with a name, position, and attributes.
11. Offer(player: Player, director: Director): Represents an official offer made by the director for a player.

#Description 
The Team Sports Scouting System is used by various employees of the club, including the head coach, the director of the club and the scouts. It is the role of the head coach to identify designated player profiles for future signings, which includes designated target positions for a player (e.g. GK for goalkeeper, LB for left back, etc.), and other player attributes (identified by a name and a value).

Scouts may note players a long list who seem to match a designated target profile at any time. This long list is periodically evaluated by the head scout when setting up scouting assignments for his team to investigate a specific player more thoroughly. As the completion of a scouting assignment, the scout submits a scouting report about the player, which includes the pros and cons of the player as well as a recommendation (e.g. key player, first team player, reserve team player, prospective player, not a good signing). 

After comparing first scouting results for a designated player profile, the head coach and the head scout decide upon which players to move to the short list. Several other rounds of scouting can be carried out for each short-listed player as part of scouting assignments-some of which is carried out by the head scout himself. If a player is finally recommended for signing by the head scout, the director makes an official offer for the player.

1. **TargetPosition**

   - LB (Left Back)

   - KeyPlayer

   - ReserveTeamPlayer
   - ProspectivePlayer
   - NotAGoodSigning

### Classes:
1. **TeamSportsScoutingSystem**
   - Attributes:
     - employees: List<Employee>
     - designatedPlayerProfiles: List<DesignatedPlayerProfile>
     - scoutingAssignments: List<ScoutingAssignment>

4. **Director**
   - Inherits: Employee
   - Methods:
     - makeOfficialOffer(player: Player)

5. **Scout**
   - Inherits: Employee
   - Methods:
     - notePlayer(player: Player)
     - submitScoutingReport(player: Player, pros: List<String>, cons: List<String>, recommendation: Recommendation)

6. **Player**
   - Attributes:

     - position: TargetPosition
     - attributes: List<PlayerAttribute>

7. **DesignatedPlayerProfile**
   - Attributes:
     - targetPosition: TargetPosition
     - otherAttributes: List<PlayerAttribute>

8. **ScoutingAssignment**
   - Attributes:
     - scout: Scout

- **TeamSportsScoutingSystem**
  - employees: List<Employee>
  - designatedPlayerProfiles: List<DesignatedPlayerProfile>
  - scoutingAssignments: List<ScoutingAssignment>
  - shortListedPlayers: List<Player>
  
- **Employee**

AI:Enumerations:
1. TargetPosition(GK, LB, ...): Represents the designated target positions for players in the scouting system.
2. PlayerAttribute(name: String, value: String): Represents additional attributes of a player identified by name and value.
3. Recommendation(KeyPlayer, FirstTeamPlayer, ...): Represents the recommendations for player signings.

Classes:
1. TeamSportsScoutingSystem(employees: List<Employee>, designatedPlayerProfiles: List<DesignatedPlayerProfile>, scoutingAssignments: List<ScoutingAssignment>, shortListedPlayers: List<Player): Represents the main system used by club employees for scouting players.
2. Employee(role: String): Represents a generic employee in the club.
3. HeadCoach(role: String, identifyDesignatedPlayerProfiles(): Method for the head coach to identify designated player profiles.
4. Director(role: String, makeOfficialOffer(player: Player): Method for the director to make an official offer for a player.
5. Scout(role: String, notePlayer(player: Player), submitScoutingReport(player: Player, pros: List<String>, cons: List<String>, recommendation: Recommendation): Represents the scout in the system with methods to note players and submit scouting reports.
6. Player(name: String, position: TargetPosition, attributes: List<PlayerAttribute): Represents a player with a name, position, and additional attributes.
7. DesignatedPlayerProfile(targetPosition: TargetPosition, otherAttributes: List<PlayerAttribute): Represents a designated player profile with a target position and other attributes.
8. ScoutingAssignment(scout: Scout, player: Player, evaluation: String): Represents a scouting assignment with a scout, player, and evaluation.

Classes:
1. Employee(role: string, name: string, email: string): Represents an employee with a role, name, and email address.
2. HeadCoach(designatedPlayerProfiles: List<PlayerProfile>): Represents the head coach with designated player profiles for future signings.
3. Director(scoutingSystem: TeamSportsScoutingSystem): Represents the director of the club with access to the scouting system.
4. Scout(longList: List<Player>, scoutingReports: List<ScoutingReport>): Represents a scout with a long list of players and scouting reports.
5. Player(name: string, position: PlayerPosition, attributes: List<PlayerAttribute>): Represents a player with a name, position, and attributes.
6. PlayerProfile(targetPositions: List<PlayerPosition>, otherAttributes: List<PlayerAttribute]): Represents a player profile with target positions and other attributes.
7. ScoutingReport(pros: string, cons: string, recommendation: string): Represents a scouting report with pros, cons, and a recommendation.
8. ShortList(players: List<Player>): Represents a short list of players.
9. ScoutingAssignment(scout: Scout, player: Player): Represents a scouting assignment between a scout and a player.
10. TeamSportsScoutingSystem(headCoach: HeadCoach, director: Director, headScout: Scout, shortList: ShortList, scoutingAssignments: List<ScoutingAssignment>): Represents the team sports scouting system with key roles and assignments.

9. ShortList(players: List<Player>): Represents a short list of players selected for further evaluation.
10. OfficialOffer(player: Player): Represents an official offer made by the director for a player.

AI:### Enumerations:

### Classes:
1. Employee (Name: string, Role: string): Represents an employee of the club with a name and role within the organization.
2. HeadCoach (DesignatedPlayerProfiles: List<DesignatedPlayerProfile>): Represents the head coach who identifies designated player profiles for future signings.
3. Director (Name: string): Represents the director of the club.
4. Scout (LongList: List<Player>, ScoutingAssignments: List<ScoutingAssignment>): Represents a scout who maintains a long list of players and scouting assignments.

6. ScoutingAssignment (Player: Player, ScoutingReport: ScoutingReport): Represents a scouting assignment for a player including the player and scouting report.
7. ScoutingReport (Pros: string, Cons: string, Recommendation: Recommendation): Represents a scouting report containing pros, cons, and a recommendation for a player.

### Attributes:
1. PlayerAttribute (Name: string, Value: string): Represents an attribute of a player identified by a name and value.
2. DesignatedPlayerProfile (TargetPosition: PlayerPosition, OtherAttributes: List<PlayerAttribute>): Represents a designated player profile with a target position and other attributes.
3. ShortList (Players: List<Player>): Represents a list of players moved to the short list for further evaluation.
4. OfficialOffer (Player: Player): Represents an official offer made by the director for a player recommended for signing.

Scouts may note players a long list who seem to match a designated target profile at any time. This long list is periodically evaluated by the head scout when setting up scouting assignments for his team to investigate a specific player more thoroughly. As the completion of a scouting assignment, the scout submits a scouting report about the player, which includes the pros and cons of the player as well as a recommendation (e.g. key player, first team player, reserve team player, prospective player, not a good signing). 

After comparing first scouting results for a designated player profile, the head coach and the head scout decide upon which players to move to the short list. Several other rounds of scouting can be carried out for each short-listed player as part of scouting assignments-some of which is carried out by the head scout himself. If a player is finally recommended for signing by the head scout, the director makes an official offer for the player.

Classes:
1. ClubEmployee(Role):Represents a generic club employee with a specific role within the organization.
2. HeadCoach(DesignatedPlayerProfiles):Represents the head coach who identifies designated player profiles for future signings.
3. Director(MakeOffer):Represents the director who makes official offers for players.
4. Scout(LongList, ScoutingReport, ScoutingAssignments):Represents a scout who maintains a long list of potential players, submits scouting reports, and carries out scouting assignments.
5. Player(Name, Position, Attributes):Represents a player with a name, position, and various attributes.
6. ScoutingAssignment(Player, Scout, ScoutingReport):Represents a scouting assignment linking a player, scout, and scouting report.
7. ScoutingReport(Pros, Cons, Recommendation):Represents a scouting report with pros, cons, and a recommendation for a player.
8. ShortList(Players):Represents a short list of players selected for further consideration.
9. OfficialOffer(Player):Represents an official offer made by the director for a player.
